resources.string: Tasker Health Connect
Grant Permissions
Permissions are granted and Health Connect is available. Open Tasker, and look for Tasker Health Connect inside Action -> Plugins
Not all permissions have been granted, open the Health Connect app to grant permissions
Health connect is not installed or is unavailable, check for updates
Health Connect is unavailable or permissions are not granted
Install Health Connect
Debug
Done
Class of the type of Health Record
The Class of the type of Health Record. This must be a valid class from androidx.health.connect.client.records.* package, e.g. StepsRecord. Supports Tasker Variables.
Start Time Epoch Milliseconds
The timestamp (in epoch milliseconds) to start fetching records from. Supports Tasker Variables.
End Time Epoch Milliseconds
The timestamp (in epoch milliseconds) to stop fetching records from. Supports Tasker Variables.
Aggregated Health Data
Aggregated Health Data will be returned as a JSON array of records.
Write Data
Health Data
Health Data will be returned as a JSON array, each object in the array corresponds to record of data. The fields of the object will contain specific data for type of record.
Record IDs
The response will include a list of the record IDs inserted.
JSON Object or List of Objects to write
Version %s
Check for updates
Aggregate Metric Class.Field
The Aggregate Metric to return from androidx.health.connect.client.records.* package, must be in the format ClassName.FieldName, e.g. StepsRecord.COUNT_TOTAL
